Text: Anyone get this to work? It still day countdown even if I do exactly as it says by replacing those files. Where should I put this ActivationServices.dll? Among those other installed files?

ActivationServices.dll should be placed in the 
Common Files folder in the folder where DxO is installed, default being:

C: > Program Files > DxO Labs > Common Files
Thx, but is there supposed to be a folder named 'Common Files'? I don't have any. Now when I have uninstall it and reinstalled. Same problem, day counting and no Common Files dir. WTF?
Problem solved... nvm! Thx for the help.

Big thanks for that! :)

Highlight recovery is only possibel on RAW files.

Right Dayrider! DxO is not clairvoyant althought it's close.  :-)  Heck! What is it to recover from 24 bits JPEG anyway... ? All in all it's a matter of interpolation in color depth and that will never be a true highlight recover. :-(
